author: Thomas Gebremedhin
title: Q&A With Cosima von Bonin
text:
ALTHOUGH HER WORK spans a range of mediums, Cologne, Germany–based conceptual artist Cosima von Bonin, 55, is perhaps best known for her tongue-in-cheek sculptures that reference objects and images drawn from popular culture. Past pieces include oversize stuffed animals, scooters, and clams on skateboards. Understandably, these pieces have earned her comparisons to Jeff Koons and Claes Oldenburg; and similar to these artists’ work, von Bonin’s bright, whimsical sculptures are deceptive in their simplicity, deftly tackling challenging themes including appropriation, identity, and the environment.
